text:
For The Http Request, having the Proper Setting of the Tread Group (Of count 1 
and Treads of 150 adn Ramp Up Period of 60s.)then Jemeter  Get Hanged. not Able 
to Collect the Listerner Response.

Is this Jmeter Limitation or Web-Server Limitation.
creator: rushikeshk@productdossier.com

text:
For the This Thread Group It always Gives the Jmeter Response as Not Responding.
Tried to Replicate the same Situation in Client-Server Mode..its having the 
same case there too.
creator: rushikeshk@productdossier.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Please specify version of JMeter, OS and JVM.
Please also attach jmeter.log file.

We use JMeter 2.0.2 in non-GUI mode, and regularly run tests that generate 
10,000 or more requests over several hours. [But these are not HTTP requests.]

I suggest you try using non-GUI mode, and remove all listeners.

Please specify version of JMeter, OS and JVM.
Please also attach jmeter.log file.

We use JMeter 2.0.2 in non-GUI mode, and regularly run tests that generate 
10,000 or more requests over several hours. [But these are not HTTP requests.]

As a work-round, I suggest you try using non-GUI mode, and remove all listeners.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 14947
Jmeter Log for Notresponding Jmeter Action

Additional Information Regarding Test:
Jmeter Version 2.0.1
Jvm 1.4.2

System OS: win NT
SYstem Confi.: P3,128 RAM.
creator: rushikeshk@productdossier.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Can't see anything obvious in the log, except the test run seems very short - 
Thread Group1-1 starts at 09:36:07 and finishes at 09:36:17. Others take 
longer, but the total run-time is only 10 minutes or so.

I suggest you upgrade to 2.0.3, as that has quite a few fixes compared with 
2.0.1.

Might be worth increasing the ramp-up to 150.

Also, when you say that JMeter hangs, does it eventually complete?
Or do some threads never finish, even if you wait for several minutes?
If running in GUI mode, does JMeter successfully process the Stop command?

You wrote:
"For the This Thread Group It always Gives the Jmeter Response as Not 
Responding"
Can you explain what you mean by this?

First i THought it may be the Problem of Heap Size for the JVM application i 
Increase the Heap Size But Still Jmeter Stop responding after more than 500 
count.
Stop Responding Means: do some threads never finish, even if you wait for 
several minutes.

I did it for the NOn GUI Application, it giving the Result in Log 
File ...working for more than 5000 Threads...but not able to Interpret the 
Result...whats the average Result for all the action and things like that..it 
Giving the Responce of each http request that server handled.
creator: rushikeshk@productdossier.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Please try the test again with JMeter 2.0.3.

If it still fails, then attach a test case.

Does not seem to be a problem with later versions of JMeter.

Please re-open if it is occurring in 2.1.1
creator: sebb@apache.org
